xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 24 May 2013
xwikidoc.content: <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 10:18 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 10:36 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 10:52 <sdumitriu1> Hey Ravi 10:53 <ravigarg27> Hi 10:54 <ravigarg27> I am working on that 10:54 <ravigarg27> a small bit of time more 11:38 <ravigarg27> hey sdumitriu1, http://pastebin.com/pAqdzjFU pls have a look 11:39 <sdumitriu1> Looking 11:39 <sdumitriu1> Something seems wrong, let me check 11:47 <sdumitriu1> OK, so the alignment algorithms are the opposite of edit distance algorithm 11:47 <sdumitriu1> The purpose is to have the highest score possible 11:48 <sdumitriu1> So you should reward with positive scores good matches, and penalize mismatches 11:48 <ravigarg27> ohh 11:48 <sdumitriu1> And after that, instead of selecting the synonym with the lowest score, select the one with the highest score 11:50 <sdumitriu1> Plus, the edges are initialized with 0 11:50 <sdumitriu1> Hm, the Wikipedia article isn't that good, it's for partial alignments 11:51 <sdumitriu1> http://www.bioinformatics.wsu.edu/bioinfo_course/notes/Lecture6.pdf 11:52 <sdumitriu1> Ah, again partial alignment 11:52 <sdumitriu1> So, just remove the "0" from the list of values to chose from in that Max 11:53 <sdumitriu1> The edges are the only ones that are initialized with 0 11:53 <ravigarg27> ok, and I will change the penalty values too 11:54 <ravigarg27> as given in the link 11:54 <sdumitriu1> Yep 11:55 <sdumitriu1> Match positive, mismatch/gap negative 11:55 <sdumitriu1> And now you learn bioinformatics :) 11:55 <ravigarg27> hehe true 11:55 <sdumitriu1> Smith-Waterman is one of the fundamental algorithms 12:06 <ravigarg27> ok made the changes, should I send a commit with original file or just send you this as separate code? 12:09 <sdumitriu1> Show me once more, then do a pull request 12:09 <ravigarg27> ok, http://pastebin.com/GKW7iER7 12:10 <sdumitriu1> if (n == 0) { return m; } if (m == 0) { return n; } 12:10 <sdumitriu1> This is still wrong 12:10 <ravigarg27> I will remove that 12:24 <ravigarg27> hii ccm_marta, 12:25 <ccm_marta> hey ravigarg27 12:25 <ccm_marta> i see you're learning alignment methods :) 12:28 <ravigarg27> yeah a bit of bioinformatics :) 12:32 <ravigarg27_> has joined #ccm 12:57 <sdumitriu1> ravigarg27: Sorry, a bit busy 12:57 <ravigarg27> yeah np, 12:57 <sdumitriu1> I think it would be better to start from scratch with a clean S-W implementation 12:57 <sdumitriu1> Trying to adapt the old code made a mess out of it 12:58 <sdumitriu1> It shouldn't take more than 20-30 lines of code in total 12:59 <ravigarg27> yeah ok, there were a couple of more mistakes when I tried running it 12:59 <ravigarg27> will let you know when it gives proper result 13:50 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 14:16 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 14:20 <xwiki_sdumitriu> Hey kushalkhandelwal 14:20 <xwiki_sdumitriu> How's it going? 14:20 <kushalkhandelwal> Hey 14:21 <kushalkhandelwal> In new city , looking for acco , have to move out of my temp acco by sunday 14:21 <kushalkhandelwal> Was a tiring day , long walks in heat : 14:21 <kushalkhandelwal> :\ 14:21 <xwiki_sdumitriu> Oh, that's nasty 14:21 <kushalkhandelwal> Rest going good ? 14:21 <xwiki_sdumitriu> I don't like looking for places 14:21 <kushalkhandelwal> I know 14:21 <kushalkhandelwal> It is difficult in a city where I am 14:21 <xwiki_sdumitriu> Here it's almost freezing 14:22 <kushalkhandelwal> No one ready to give for 2 months for summer 14:22 <kushalkhandelwal> Oh nice 14:22 <kushalkhandelwal> Winters are better 14:22 <kushalkhandelwal> so org meeting today ? 14:22 <kushalkhandelwal> what's up with "xwiki_" ? 14:23 <kushalkhandelwal> And acco is expensive in mumbai :\ Hate the place 14:23 <kushalkhandelwal> Oh org admins have to append org name in front for meeting 14:23 <kushalkhandelwal> Nice 14:24 <xwiki_sdumitriu> It's required for the meeting on #gsoc 14:25 <kushalkhandelwal> Done with the meeting ? 14:26 <xwiki_sdumitriu> No, it starts in 33 minutes 14:27 <kushalkhandelwal> Oh :)
